greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array read by antidiagonals with rows generated by 1/(1-x-x^(k+1)).
comment: Sections of rows are given by array A099233. Sums of antidiagonals yield A097939.
The triangle of diagonals terminated after reaching the repeating value is A329146. - _Andrey Zabolotskiy_, Sep 01 2020
formula: Square array T(n, k) = Sum_{j=0..floor(n/(k+1))} binomial(n-k*j, j), n, k>=0.
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Oct 08 2004
